title: (x) Church-y, gothic geometric sans with crossed "O" - Exocet {Dav}
content:
Hi. I just wanted to ask if any of you are familiar with this font that I've been looking for quite a long time already. I don't know what it's called. It looks like century gothic (even width of lines) with a serif, and the most distinctive letter is the capital 'O' because it has a cross in the middle. The font has this church-y, almost gothic feel to it. Hope you can help. Thanks.

[http://i27.photobucket.com/albums/c155/wingspread/o.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020110315/http:/i27.photobucket.com/albums/c155/wingspread/o.jpg "http://i27.photobucket.com/albums/c155/wingspread/o.jpg")
author: wingspread

comments.content:
' [Exocet](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020110315/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=95)', by Jonathan Barnbrook?

_( Please note, for future requests, that there is [a one-of-a-kind, dedicated 'Type ID Board', at Typophile](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020110315/http:/typophile.com/forum/29). :)_

Dav

Yep, that's it. Thanks very much. Happy, happy.

Maybe the moderator/s can delete this topic already to free up space in this forum? Thanks for moving it to the appropriate section, btw.
